Articles.Content:
I believe some of the pack already is scaled to the 8.4m Ares/SLS standard so that's part of the work already done.

So... everything Chaka is strictly 75% scale, you'l find that true of the Delta IV - like systems, Orion, and the SLS size products. Making them 100% would mean not being able to assemble a Block II SLS rocket in the VAB. 75% is not only a convenient measure from the 5 meter Orion capsule to be 3.75 meters Kerbol, but it's also the correct maximum vehicle height in the kerbal VAB relative to the real one.

Picture Treats!

I do need to say one thing further about Chaka in the "realism" world... Kerbal "liquid fuel" is most certainly more like RP-1 than H2/LOX ... but even then not quite. However, Chaka rockets are depicted almost exclusively as H2/LOX systems yet... use a fairly standard Kerbal fuel setup. I have chosen for now to overlook this detail to make developing new rockets less complicated, however I think if one is going to go through all the trouble to use "real" anything, one should also be compelled to do so with the fuels.

Edited August 5, 2014 by YANFRET
Man classes are back in session for me so my playtime is super limited xD and right before the next update too! You make me want to procrastinate so I can enjoy your amazing work yanfret lol

EDIT- Save craft made before will still show and have both fuels but you can empty them in VAB.

hahaha no lol I guess I never really examined the upperstage of the SLS like that. Now that I look at the them I can't unsee it. I always just assumed it was smooth and the same size all the way down to the interstage. Seriously I can't find a picture where it looks like I think of it.

hahaha no lol I guess I never really examined the upperstage of the SLS like that. Now that I look at the them I can't unsee it. I always just assumed it was smooth and the same size all the way down to the interstage. Seriously I can't find a picture where it looks like I think of it.

Yeah, technically the upper stage Yanfret is using for his Orion is the Delta IV Heavy upper stage (5m diameter in real life, DCSS), but it's being adapted as an interim first stage for the SLS and Orion.

Atlas, the one you pictured with the CST-100 (which is not Orion), use the Centaur upper stage, which has a totally different structure than the DCSS.

Yeah, technically the upper stage Yanfret is using for his Orion is the Delta IV Heavy upper stage (5m diameter in real life, DCSS), but it's being adapted as an interim first stage for the SLS and Orion.

Atlas, the one you pictured with the CST-100 (which is not Orion), use the Centaur upper stage, which has a totally different structure than the DCSS.

No I definitely knew the was the CST-100. I got confused because maybe a page or two back we were discussing an efficent way of getting the Orion into LKO with out useing the Ares 1 SRB design. And the idea of Falcon 9, Delta, and Atlas were mentioned so I thought he was making an Atlas type upper stage.

Edit: See page 70

Edited August 9, 2014 by sp1989

In the early SLS block I renderings, the art department at JSC was rendering the upper stage fairings straight up and down. You can still find lots of graphics which show it that way. Then they were told that because the Orion capsule itself is 5 meters |<->| and the service module adapter, LES, and SM fairings are like 5.3 meters so they can fit around it. That's where you get the signature ring around the base of the capsule when shown on its service module.

Then to explain further, in the wind tunnel and in crush tests, it was found that the in+out kink in the fairings is more rigid and/or lighter than a direct fairing between the SM and the 5 meter upper.
